message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We used a combination of satellite-derived data on land use and land cover and household survey data to investigate changes in agricultural production and land use patterns in Ghana.", "dataset": ["satellite-derived data", "household survey data"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This research draws on a unique dataset of patent applications made by firms in emerging economies over the past decade, as well as complementary firm-level data on R&D investments and innovation outcomes.", "dataset": ["dataset of patent applications", "firm-level data on R&D investments", "innovation outcomes"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We examine the impact of recent debt crises on sovereign risk using cross-sectional data from 32 countries and time-series data from 1996 to 2018.", "dataset": ["cross-sectional data", "time-series data"], "topic": ["Debt"]}, {"sentence": "This paper analyzes the impact of broadband internet access on poverty using household survey data from four African countries and a complementary dataset on mobile phone penetration.", "dataset": ["household survey data", "dataset on mobile phone penetration"], "topic": ["Digital Development", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We explore the linkages between disaster risk reduction and social protection using a novel dataset on natural disasters and household vulnerability in Bangladesh and a complementary dataset on social protection programs.", "dataset": ["dataset on natural disasters and household vulnerability in Bangladesh", "dataset on social protection programs"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Social Protection"]}, {"sentence": "This study investigates the impact of teacher training policies on primary school student learning outcomes using administrative data on teacher training programs and complementary data on student test scores.", "dataset": ["administrative data on teacher training programs", "data on student test scores"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze the impact of carbon pricing policies on electricity demand in the US using hourly data on electricity consumption and a complementary dataset on state-level carbon pricing initiatives.", "dataset": ["hourly data on electricity consumption", "dataset on state-level carbon pricing initiatives"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use household survey data from Mexico, Peru, and Ecuador to explore the determinants of financial inclusion and complement this data with administrative records on bank account ownership.", "dataset": ["household survey data from Mexico, Peru, and Ecuador", "administrative records on bank account ownership"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "This report investigates challenges related to urban infrastructure development and financing by drawing on data from three datasets: the World Bank's City Creditworthiness Initiative, the United Nations Development Programme's Government Spending Dataset, and the Global Open Data Index.", "dataset": ["World Bank's City Creditworthiness Initiative", "United Nations Development Programme's Government Spending Dataset", "Global Open Data Index"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "We estimate the impact of international migration on wages and employment outcomes in source countries using household survey data and census data from four South Asian countries and a complementary dataset on bilateral migration flows.", "dataset": ["household survey data", "census data from four South Asian countries", "dataset on bilateral migration flows"], "topic": ["Migration"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "We used a combination of satellite-derived data on land use and land cover and household survey data to investigate changes in agricultural production and land use patterns in Ghana.", "dataset": ["satellite-derived data", "household survey data"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This research draws on a unique dataset of patent applications made by firms in emerging economies over the past decade, as well as complementary firm-level data on R&D investments and innovation outcomes.", "dataset": ["dataset of patent applications", "firm-level data on R&D Bangladesh", "dataset on social protection programs"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Social Protection"]}, {"sentence": "This study investigates the impact of teacher training policies on primary school student learning outcomes using administrative data on teacher training programs and complementary data on student test scores.", "dataset": ["administrative data on teacher training programs", "data on student test scores"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze the impact of carbon pricing policies on electricity demand in the US using hourly data on electricity consumption and a complementary dataset on state-level carbon pricing initiatives.", "dataset": ["hourly data on electricity consumption", "dataset on state-level carbon pricing initiatives"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use household survey data from Mexico, Peru, and Ecuador to explore the determinants of financial inclusion and complement this data with wages and employment outcomes in source countries using household survey data and census data from four South Asian countries and a complementary dataset on bilateral migration flows.", "dataset": ["household survey data", "census data from four South Asian countries", "dataset on bilateral migration flows"], "topic": ["Migration"]}]
